Pre-Game Insights: The Kansas City Royals and the Cleveland Guardians meet Wednesday in MLB action from Progressive Field.
This will be the final installment in a four-game series.
The Royals took on the Philadelphia Phillies in their last set, winning the first pair but losing the next two.
The Guardians played the Texas Rangers in their weekend series, managing a sweep with wins 5-3, 13-3, and 4-2.
In the Tuesday matchup versus KC, the Guardians gave up three runs in the seventh and couldn’t recover.
Starter Gavin Williams posted 5.0 innings with two earned runs.
Michael Wacha is starting for the Royals with a record of 11-6 and a 3.32 ERA in 23 starts.
Tanner Bibee is starting for the Guardians with a record of 10-6 and a 3.46 ERA over 25 starts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ten of the Guardians' last 12 day games after playing the previous day have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Five of the Royals' last six day games against AL Central opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
